closure_properties: closed under reduction, contains neutral terms

definition: CR(A -> B) = {M | for all N in CR(A), M N in CR(B)}
closure_properties: closed under expansion, application preserves membership

definition: CR(A x B) = {(M,N) | M in CR(A) and N in CR(B)}
closure_properties: closed under projection, pairing preserves membership

definition: CR(A + B) = {inl M | M in CR(A)} union {inr N | N in CR(B)}
closure_properties: closed under injection, case preserves membership

definition: CR(Pi x:A.B) = {M | for all N in CR(A), M N in CR(B[N/x])}
closure_properties: closed under substitution, abstraction preserves membership

definition: CR(Sigma x:A.B) = {(M,N) | M in CR(A) and N in CR(B[M/x])}
CR(Type_i) = {A | A is a type in universe i and all elements of A are reducible}
CR(Ind) defined by induction on strictly positive constructors
closure_properties: closed under constructor application, eliminator computes

definition: NE(A) = {x, M N, elim, ... | in CR(A)}
[[A]] = interpretation of A in domain model
HR(A) defined coinductively for infinite types
